intro: Sison trinervium, commonly known as the three-veined sison, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each leaflet having three distinct veins. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
